pricePoints.item: Dollars toward providing long-lasting insecticide-treated bed nets to help prevent the spread of malaria
Malaria nets, each protecting an average of 1.8 people for 3 years
Lives saved, according to the Against Malaria Foundation and Dr. Christen Lengeler of the Swiss Tropical Institute
Lives saved, according to a conservative estimate by GiveWell
Dollars toward providing chlorine-dispensers for safe drinking water
Community members provided with safe water for an entire year
Dollars toward protecting students against neglected tropical diseases
Students protected from neglected tropical diseases for one year, reducing absenteeism by 25%, and increasing future wages by 23% and work hours by 12%
Dollars toward funding the associated costs of fistula repair surgery for women
Women's transportation to and from the hospital (on average)
Anesthetists provided for women's surgeries (on average)
Patients provided with nursing care (on average)
Women's fistula repair surgeries funded in entirety (on average)
Dollars toward eliminating global preventable blindness and vision impairment
Cataract surgeries (in some developing countries) preventing avoidable blindness
Dollars given directly to poor households in Kenya and Uganda to use as they wish, increasing recipients' assets and food security while reducing stress and depression during the following years
Household members funded for one to two years
Households funded for one to two years
Dollars toward creating lasting solutions to the injustice of poverty where needed most in the 90+ countries where Oxfam works
Children provided with school meal programs for one year
Farming households provided with seeds and tools
Latrines built to protect the health of families displaced by natural disasters
Hand washing stations built at rural schools to prevent the spread of disease
Communities provided with legal support to take on a mining company
Schools built to provide girls with the opportunity to get an education
Dollars toward helping people in the developing world to lead healthier lives and plan the families they desire
Years of healthy life (DALYs) added through PSI's operations

oldPricePoints.item: Male condoms delivered, helping to reduce the spread of HIV and improve family planning
Oral contraceptives delivered, improving the ability of women to plan for the families they desire, improving their health and the health of their children
Long-lasting insecticide treated nets delivered to help reduce the spread of malaria

pricePoints.item: Dollars toward providing high-quality, low-cost healthcare to the World's poor
Patients provided with high-quality health care in rural Nepal
Dollars toward designing and implementing country-wide, market-based food fortification programs
People provided with fortified food for one year
Dollars toward helping those who are at risk and suffering from neglected tropical diseases in sub-Saharan Africa
Children and at-risk adults treated against debilitating neglected tropical diseases for one year
Entire schools treated against neglected tropical diseases for one year
Dollars toward preventing blindness, providing eyesight-restoring surgeries, and developing sustainable eye care programs in the world's most impoverished communities
People in need provided with eyeglasses
Blind individuals' eyesight restored
Children provided with specialized sight-restoring pediatric surgery and follow-up care
Days of eye camp and outreach services funded, each day restoring sight to 30 people
Rural eye hospitals built, equipped, and brought into operation with a surgical theater and full-time opthalmologist
Dollars toward implementing and scaling up programs which have been demonstrated to be impactful and cost-effective
